strategy: Replace Ridge Regression with a Gradient Boosting Machine (e.g., XGBoost or LightGBM) using the same polynomial features. Gradient boosting excels at capturing complex non-linear patterns and interactions between features, which can improve predictive power beyond linear models. Use early stopping during training to prevent overfitting and apply cross-validation to tune hyperparameters such as learning rate, number of estimators, and max depth. This approach leverages ensemble learning to build a more flexible and powerful model while retaining the non-linear feature engineering from polynomial expansion.
